ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Critical thinking and awareness towards historiographical strategies and praxis. These points were mostly implied on musicological texts and discussions but not exclusively, what enriched the discussion and made it interdisciplinary.
Gained knowledge of historiographical and theoretical debates and positions

I received a thorough, insightful survey of historiographical changes in my field. I think this course really helped my ability to think about larger questions pertinent to the work musicologists do and see the field in a way that isn't so buried in scores and primary sources.

Different historical methods for music research Drawing from a lot of different fields for their insight (anthropology, psychoanalysis, philosophy etc) Developed new ways to approach my research interests

This course helped me to understand how historiography can relate to my own work. It discussed some of the issues when writing or creating histories, but it also introduced me to some of the foundational musicological literature.
historiographical insights into music history, critical reading

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The course was well organized, the mid-term paper proved itself to be a good preparation towards the end term paper and helped consolidating the central points discussed.
weaknesses: more guidance on papers would have been nice strengths: everything else

Dr. Tomlinson's understanding of the texts we read and his plan for the course were great. I do think we could have had a better experience if discussion among students was encouraged more. It was more of a lecture environment at times.

Sometimes the definitions to specific terminology was not clarified, and only weeks later did I understand what specific terms mean. Having clear project aims and deadlines from the beginning of the semester would also help.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Absolutely.This was one of the most enriching classes I've ever taken.
Yes, if they were willing to work, although since it's required, they would have to take it even if they weren't
Yes, the material was helpful in understanding the field of musicology and Dr. Tomlinson was a fantastic guide through it.
